agent_utterance: Try this simple, low-effort plan now: 1) Drink a large glass of water (250–300 ml). 2) Take a 10-minute pause before deciding on food, and check whether you’re really hungry or just thirsty. 3) If you want a snack, choose one flexible option: 1) apple with a handful of almonds, 2) yogurt with berries, or 3) cucumber slices with hummus. 4) For dinner, aim for a light plate: protein about palm-size, half your plate as vegetables, and a small portion of whole grains. 5) Set a 30-minute reminder to check in on hunger/fullness and adjust if needed. Small, doable steps reduce overwhelm and support consistency.
